title: Christmas Every Day and Other Stories Told for Children
creator: William Dean Howells
source: Librivox recording of a public-domain text
description: LibriVox recording of Christmas Every Day and Other Stories Told for Children, by William Dean Howells. Read by David Wales. Five short delightful stories for children, told in the voice of "the papa" to "the girl" and "the boy." William Dean Howells (March 1, 1837 – May 11, 1920) was an American realist author and literary critic. Nicknamed "The Dean of American Letters", he was particularly known for his tenure as editor of the Atlantic Monthly as well as his own prolific writings, including the Christmas story "Christmas Every Day" and the novel The Rise of Silas Lapham. (Reader’s Note for story 3: A pony engine is a small locomotive for switching cars from one track to another.) (Summary by Wikipedia and David Wales) For further information, including links to online text, reader information, RSS feeds, CD cover or other formats (if available), please go to the LibriVox catalog page for this recording. For more free audio books or to become a volunteer reader, visit LibriVox.org. M4B format available
subject: librivox; audiobook; Christmas; short stories; children

reviews.reviewbody: Sweet stories and David is an excellent reader.  Thanks for making these available in such a high quality format.
